tap.log

Class DefaultTAPLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • uws.service.log.DefaultUWSLog
      • tap.log.DefaultTAPLog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TAPLog, UWSLog

    public class DefaultTAPLog
extends DefaultUWSLog
implements TAPLog
    Default implementation of the TAPLog interface which lets logging any message about a TAP service.
    Version:
    2.0 (04/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)
    See Also:
    DefaultUWSLog

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultTAPLog

        public DefaultTAPLog(UWSFileManager fm)

        Builds a TAPLog which will use the given file manager to get the log output (see UWSFileManager.getLogOutput(uws.service.log.UWSLog.LogLevel, String)).

        note 1: This constructor is particularly useful if the way of managing log output may change in the given file manager. Indeed, the output may change in function of the type of message to log (UWSLog.LogLevel).

        note 2 If no output can be found in the file manager the standard error output (System.err) will be chosen automatically for all log messages.

        Parameters:
        fm - A TAP file manager.
        See Also:
        DefaultUWSLog.DefaultUWSLog(UWSFileManager)

      • DefaultTAPLog

        public DefaultTAPLog(java.io.OutputStream output)

        Builds a TAPLog which will print all its messages into the given stream.

        note: the given output will be used whatever is the type of message to log (UWSLog.LogLevel).

        Parameters:
        output - An output stream.
        See Also:
        DefaultUWSLog.DefaultUWSLog(OutputStream)

      • DefaultTAPLog

        public DefaultTAPLog(java.io.PrintWriter writer)

        Builds a TAPLog which will print all its messages into the given stream.

        note: the given output will be used whatever is the type of message to log (UWSLog.LogLevel).

        Parameters:
        writer - A print writer.
        See Also:
        DefaultUWSLog.DefaultUWSLog(PrintWriter)

    • Method Detail

      • printException

        protected void printException(java.lang.Throwable error,
                  java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Description copied from class: DefaultUWSLog

        Format and print the given exception inside the given writer.

        This function does nothing if the given error is NULL.

        The full stack trace is printed ONLY for unknown exceptions.

        The printed text has the following format for known exceptions:

         Caused by a {ExceptionClassName} {ExceptionOrigin}
     {ExceptionMessage}

        The printed text has the following format for unknown exceptions:

         Caused by a {ExceptionFullStackTrace}
        Overrides:
        printException in class DefaultUWSLog
        Parameters:
        error - The exception to print.
        out - The output in which the exception must be written.
        See Also:
        DefaultUWSLog.getExceptionOrigin(Throwable)

      • logDB

        public void logDB(UWSLog.LogLevel level,
         DBConnection connection,
         java.lang.String event,
         java.lang.String message,
         java.lang.Throwable error)
        Description copied from interface: TAPLog

        Log a message and/or an error in the DB (database) context.

        List of all events sent by the library (case sensitive):

        • CONNECTION_LACK
        • TRANSLATE
        • EXECUTE
        • RESULT
        • LOAD_TAP_SCHEMA
        • CLEAN_TAP_SCHEMA
        • CREATE_TAP_SCHEMA
        • TABLE_EXIST
        • COLUMN_EXIST
        • EXEC_UPDATE
        • ADD_UPLOAD_TABLE
        • DROP_UPLOAD_TABLE
        • START_TRANSACTION
        • COMMIT
        • ROLLBACK
        • END_TRANSACTION
        • CLOSE
        Specified by:
        logDB in interface TAPLog
        Parameters:
        level - Level of the log (info, warning, error, ...). SHOULD NOT be NULL, but if NULL anyway, the level SHOULD be considered as INFO
        connection - DB connection from which this log comes. MAY be NULL
        event - Event at the origin of this log or action executed by the given database connection while this log is sent. MAY be NULL
        message - Message to log. MAY be NULL
        error - Error/Exception to log. MAY be NULL

      • logTAP

        public void logTAP(UWSLog.LogLevel level,
          java.lang.Object obj,
          java.lang.String event,
          java.lang.String message,
          java.lang.Throwable error)
        Description copied from interface: TAPLog

        Log a message and/or an error in the general context of TAP.

        One of the parameter is of type Object. This object can be used to provide more information to the log function in order to describe as much as possible the state and/or result event.

        List of all events sent by the library (case sensitive):

        • IDENT_USER (with a NULL "obj")
        • SYNC_INIT (with "obj" as an instance of TAPParameters)
        • ASYNC_INIT (with a NULL "obj")
        • START (with "obj" as an instance of TAPSyncJob)
        • UPLOADING (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • PARSING (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • START_DB_EXECUTION (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • WRITING_RESULT (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • RESULT_WRITTEN (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • START_STEP (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • END_EXEC (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • END_DB_EXECUTION (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • DROP_UPLOAD (with "obj" as an instance of TAPExecutionReport)
        • TIME_OUT (with "obj" as an instance of TAPSyncJob)
        • END (with "obj" as an instance of TAPSyncJob)
        Specified by:
        logTAP in interface TAPLog
        Parameters:
        level - Level of the log (info, warning, error, ...). SHOULD NOT be NULL, but if NULL anyway, the level SHOULD be considered as INFO
        obj - Object providing more information about the event/object at the origin of this log. MAY be NULL
        event - Event at the origin of this log or action currently executed by TAP while this log is sent. MAY be NULL
        message - Message to log. MAY be NULL
        error - Error/Exception to log. MAY be NULL
